templates.astext: A circular trampoline has a unique property: the ratio of its area to its circumference is equal to _int:4~50_. Determine the radius of the trampoline. (Assume Ï€ is 3.14, and round to the nearest tenth)

The cook at a local restaurant that serves primarily pizza was wondering what sizes of pizza he should offer at his place. He conducted a survey and the top three choices came to be
A. a pizza with a radius of _int:3~18_ inches,
B. a pizza with a diameter of _int:3~18_ inches
C. a pizza with the circumference of _int:3~18_ inches.
Which pizza (A/B/C) is ranked _string:1st,2nd,3rd_ when ranked from _string:least to greatest,greatest to least_ area?

templates.type: Right Triangle Trigonometry, Area of Triangle, Pythagorean Theorem
templates.astext: A triangular garden has a base of _int:10~50_ meters and a height of _int:10~70_ meters. Calculate the area of the garden.
The area of a circle is equal to its circumference. Determine the radius of the circle.

templates.type: Right Triangle Trigonometry, Area of Triangle, Pythagorean Theorem 1
templates.astext: A flagpole casts a shadow that is _int:10~20_ meters long on level ground. The angle of elevation from the tip of the shadow to the top of the flagpole is _int:45~90_ degrees. Determine the height of the flagpole.
